section: moretry.py fcmaes/moretry.py Go to the documentation of this file.00001 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 00002 """ 00003 ============================================================================= 00004 00005 Fast CMA-ES - version 1.6.11 00006 00007 (c) 2025 – Dietmar Wolz 00008 (c) 2025 – Latitude 00009 00010 License: MIT 00011 00012 File: 00013 - moretry.py 00014 00015 Description: 00016 - Parallel multi objective optimization retry using CMA-ES and differential evolution. 00017 00018 Authors: 00019 - Dietmar Wolz 00020 - romain.despoullains@latitude.eu 00021 - corentin.generet@latitude.eu 00022 00023 References: 00024 - [1] https://github.com/dietmarwo/fast-cma-es 00025 00026 00027 Documentation: 00028 - 00029 00030 ============================================================================= 00031 """ 00032 00033 import numpy as np 00034 import math, sys, time, warnings, threadpoolctl 00035 import multiprocessing as mp 00036 from multiprocessing import Process 00037 from scipy.optimize import Bounds 00038 from numpy.random import Generator, PCG64DXSM, SeedSequence 00039 from fcmaes.optimizer import de_cma, dtime, Optimizer 00040 from fcmaes import retry, advretry 00041 from loguru import logger 00042 00043 from typing import Optional, Callable, Tuple 00044 from numpy.typing import ArrayLike 00045 00046 def minimize(fun: Callable[[ArrayLike], float], 00047 bounds: Bounds, 00048 weight_bounds: Bounds, 00049 ncon: Optional[int] = 0, 00050 value_exp: Optional[float] = 2.0, 00051 value_limits: Optional[ArrayLike] = None, 00052 num_retries: Optional[int] = 1024, 00053 workers: Optional[int] = mp.cpu_count(), 00054 popsize: Optional[int] = 31, 00055 max_evaluations: Optional[int] = 50000, 00056 capacity: Optional[int] = None, 00057 optimizer: Optional[Optimizer] = None, 00058 statistic_num: Optional[int] = 0, 00059 plot_name: Optional[str] = None 00060 ) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]: 00061 """Minimization of a multi objective function of one or more variables using parallel 00062 optimization retry. 00063 00064 Parameters 00065 ---------- 00066 fun : callable 00067 The objective function to be minimized. 00068 ``fun(x) -> float`` 00069 where ``x`` is an 1-D array with shape (n,) 00070 bounds : sequence or `Bounds`, optional 00071 Bounds on variables. There are two ways to specify the bounds: 00072 1. Instance of the `scipy.Bounds` class. 00073 2. Sequence of ``(min, max)`` pairs for each element in `x`. None 00074 is used to specify no bound. 00075 weight_bounds : `Bounds`, optional 00076 Bounds on objective weights. 00077 ncon : int, optional 00078 number of constraints 00079 value_exp : float, optional 00080 exponent applied to the objective values for the weighted sum. 00081 value_limits : sequence of floats, optional 00082 Upper limit for optimized objective values to be stored. 00083 num_retries : int, optional 00084 Number of optimization retries. 00085 workers : int, optional 00086 number of parallel processes used. Default is mp.cpu_count() 00087 popsize = int, optional 00088 CMA-ES population size used for all CMA-ES runs. 00089 Not used for differential evolution. 00090 Ignored if parameter optimizer is defined. 00091 max_evaluations : int, optional 00092 Forced termination of all optimization runs after ``max_evaluations`` 00093 function evaluations. Only used if optimizer is undefined, otherwise 00094 this setting is defined in the optimizer. 00095 capacity : int, optional 00096 capacity of the evaluation store. 00097 optimizer : optimizer.Optimizer, optional 00098 optimizer to use. Default is a sequence of differential evolution and CMA-ES. 00099 plot_name : plot_name, optional 00100 if defined the pareto front is plotted during the optimization to monitor progress 00101 00102 Returns 00103 ------- 00104 xs, ys: list of argument vectors and corresponding value vectors of the optimization results. """ 00105 00106 if optimizer is None: 00107 optimizer = de_cma(max_evaluations, popsize) 00108 if capacity is None: 00109 capacity = num_retries 00110 store = retry.Store(fun, bounds, capacity = capacity, 00111 statistic_num = statistic_num) 00112 store.plot_name = plot_name 00113 xs = np.array(mo_retry(fun, weight_bounds, ncon, value_exp, 00114 store, optimizer.minimize, num_retries, value_limits, workers)) 00115 ys = np.array([fun(x) for x in xs]) 00116 return xs, ys 00117 00118 def mo_retry(fun: Callable[[ArrayLike], float], 00119 weight_bounds: Bounds, 00120 ncon: int, 00121 y_exp: float, 00122 store, 00123 optimize: Callable, 00124 num_retries: int, 00125 value_limits: ArrayLike, 00126 workers: Optional[int] = mp.cpu_count()): 00127 """ 00128 Executes a multi-objective optimization with retry functionality by distributing work across 00129 multiple processes. 00130 00131 This function performs optimization by spawning multiple processes, each executing a retry 00132 loop targeting a specific optimizer and constraints. The retries ensure robustness against 00133 failures or subpar outcomes in individual optimization attempts across the workers. 00134 00135 Args: 00136 fun (Callable[[ArrayLike], float]): The objective function to optimize. It must accept 00137 an input vector and return a scalar cost or objective value. 00138 weight_bounds (Bounds): Bounds for the weights, defining constraints on the optimization 00139 variables. 00140 ncon (int): Number of constraints to enforce during the optimization process. 00141 y_exp (float): The expected value used as a threshold or benchmark for optimization outcomes. 00142 store: An object for storing and managing results during optimization. Must support `sort` 00143 and `dump` methods, among others. 00144 optimize (Callable): Optimization function or solver to be used within the retry loop. It 00145 must be callable and compatible with the function and constraints provided. 00146 num_retries (int): The number of retries per process, ensuring multiple attempts for robust 00147 optimization results. 00148 value_limits (ArrayLike): Array-like structure specifying the acceptable limits for values 00149 during optimization. 00150 workers (Optional[int]): Number of processes to spawn for parallel optimization. Defaults 00151 to the total available CPU count. 00152 00153 Returns: 00154 xs_view: A view or representation of the sorted results stored in the `store` after the 00155 optimization process is complete. 00156 """ 00157 sg = SeedSequence() 00158 rgs = [Generator(PCG64DXSM(s)) for s in sg.spawn(workers)] 00159 proc=[Process(target=_retry_loop, 00160 args=(pid, rgs, fun, weight_bounds, ncon, y_exp, 00161 store, optimize, num_retries, value_limits)) for pid in range(workers)] 00162 [p.start() for p in proc] 00163 [p.join() for p in proc] 00164 store.sort() 00165 store.dump() 00166 return store.xs_view 00167 00168 def _retry_loop(pid, rgs, fun, weight_bounds, ncon, y_exp, 00169 store, optimize, num_retries, value_limits): 00170 """ 00171 Executes a retry loop strategy for multi-objective optimization. This 00172 process includes generating random weights, scaling them to match 00173 constraints, optimizing the given function, and storing the results 00174 if they meet specific criteria. Additionally, it may generate and 00175 save plots of results for visualization. 00176 00177 Args: 00178 pid (int): Process ID to identify and manage the random state 00179 specific to the process. 00180 rgs (List[np.random.Generator]): List of random number generators 00181 associated with each process. 00182 fun (Callable): The function to be optimized in the retry loop. 00183 weight_bounds (Bounds): The lower and upper bounds for the weights 00184 used for scaling in the optimization process. 00185 ncon (int): The number of constraints to account for during 00186 the optimization process. 00187 y_exp (float): Exponent used to adjust the scaling of weights 00188 in the optimization process. 00189 store (Store): Instance of a class responsible for managing 00190 optimization results and storing data. 00191 optimize (Callable): Optimization function that evaluates 00192 the objective or constraints based on inputs. 00193 num_retries (int): The number of retries allowed for achieving 00194 a successful optimization result. 00195 value_limits (Optional[List[float]]): Optional limits 00196 enforced on the objective values from the optimization results. 00197 If None, no objective value constraints are applied. 00198 """ 00199 store.create_xs_view() 00200 lower = store.lower 00201 wlb = np.array(weight_bounds.lb) 00202 wub = np.array(weight_bounds.ub) 00203 with threadpoolctl.threadpool_limits(limits=1, user_api="blas"): 00204 while store.get_runs_compare_incr(num_retries): 00205 try: 00206 rg = rgs[pid] 00207 w = rg.uniform(size=len(wub)) 00208 w /= _avg_exp(w, y_exp) # correct scaling 00209 w = wlb + w * (wub - wlb) 00210 wrapper = mo_wrapper(fun, w, ncon, y_exp) 00211 x, y, evals = optimize(wrapper.eval, Bounds(store.lower, store.upper), None, 00212 [rg.uniform(0.05, 0.1)]*len(lower), rg, store) 00213 objs = wrapper.mo_eval(x) # retrieve the objective values 00214 if value_limits is None or all([objs[i] < value_limits[i] for i in range(len(w))]): 00215 store.add_result(y, x, evals, np.inf) 00216 if not store.plot_name is None: 00217 name = store.plot_name + "_moretry_" + str(store.get_count_evals()) 00218 xs = np.array(store.get_xs()) 00219 ys = np.array([fun(x) for x in xs]) 00220 np.savez_compressed(name, xs=xs, ys=ys) 00221 plot(name, ncon, xs, ys) 00222 except Exception as ex: 00223 print(str(ex)) 00224 00225 def pareto(xs: np.ndarray, ys: np.ndarray): 00226 """ 00227 Filter and sort elements based on Pareto efficiency. 00228 00229 This function calculates the Pareto front for the provided arrays, `xs` 00230 and `ys`. The Pareto front contains elements that are not dominated 00231 by any other element in the dataset. The function returns the filtered 00232 and sorted elements that belong to the Pareto front sorted by the 00233 values in the associated `ys` array. 00234 00235 Args: 00236 xs: A NumPy array representing the input data values. The 00237 `xs` array contains the attributes aligned with `ys`. 00238 ys: A NumPy array indicating the criteria or objectives that 00239 the Pareto efficiency is calculated upon. 00240 00241 Returns: 00242 A tuple containing two NumPy arrays: 00243 - A filtered and sorted array of elements from `xs` 00244 corresponding to the Pareto front. 00245 - A filtered and sorted array of elements from `ys` 00246 corresponding to the Pareto front. 00247 """ 00248 par = _pareto(ys) 00249 xp = xs[par] 00250 yp = ys[par] 00251 ya = np.argsort(yp.T[0]) 00252 return xp[ya], yp[ya] 00253 00254 class mo_wrapper(object): 00255 """ 00256 Wraps a multi-objective evaluation function with additional functionality. 00257 00258 This class encapsulates a multi-objective evaluation function, integrating 00259 weights for objectives and constraints, and provides methods to evaluate the 00260 function with weight-driven adjustments and constraints handling. It is 00261 intended for use in scenarios requiring objective evaluations with flexible 00262 weighting and constraint violations. 00263 00264 Attributes: 00265 fun (Callable): The multi-objective evaluation function to be wrapped and 00266 processed. 00267 weights (list[float]): List of weights, where the first set applies to 00268 objectives, and the remainder applies to constraints. 00269 ny (int): Total number of weights, corresponding to the number of 00270 objectives and constraints combined. 00271 nobj (int): The number of objective components in the evaluation. 00272 ncon (int): The number of constraint components in the evaluation. 00273 y_exp (int): The exponential factor for averaging the weighted evaluation 00274 results. 00275 """ 00276 00277 def __init__(self, fun, weights, ncon, y_exp=2): 00278 """ 00279 Initializes an object with specified function, weights, constraints, and an optional exponent parameter. 00280 00281 Args: 00282 fun: Callable. The function to be evaluated. 00283 weights: List[float]. The weights associated with the objectives. 00284 ncon: int. The number of constraints. 00285 y_exp: int, optional. The exponent for the calculations, default is 2. 00286 """ 00287 self.fun = fun 00288 self.weights = weights 00289 self.ny = len(weights) 00290 self.nobj = self.ny - ncon 00291 self.ncon = ncon 00292 self.y_exp = y_exp 00293 00294 def eval(self, x): 00295 """ 00296 Evaluates the provided function and computes a weighted result. If there are 00297 violations in the constraints, their contribution to the result is added. 00298 00299 Args: 00300 x: Array-like, input to the function to be evaluated. 00301 00302 Returns: 00303 float: Weighted result of the evaluation including contributions from 00304 constraints, if any. 00305 """ 00306 y = self.fun(np.array(x)) 00307 weighted = _avg_exp(self.weights*y, self.y_exp) 00308 if self.ncon > 0: # check constraint violations 00309 violations = np.fromiter((i for i in range(self.nobj, self.ny) if y[i] > 0), dtype=int) 00310 if len(violations) > 0: 00311 weighted += sum(self.weights[violations]) 00312 return weighted 00313 00314 def mo_eval(self, x): 00315 """ 00316 Evaluates a given function on the input after converting it to a NumPy array. 00317 00318 Args: 00319 x: The input value to be evaluated. Should be compatible with NumPy array 00320 operations. 00321 00322 Returns: 00323 The result of the function evaluation after processing the input. 00324 """ 00325 return self.fun(np.array(x)) 00326 00327 def minimize_plot(name: str, 00328 optimizer: Optimizer, 00329 fun: Callable[[ArrayLike], float], 00330 bounds: Bounds, 00331 weight_bounds, 00332 ncon: Optional[int] = 0, 00333 value_limits: Optional[ArrayLike] = None, 00334 num_retries: Optional[int] = 1024, 00335 exp: Optional[float] = 2.0, 00336 workers: Optional[int] = mp.cpu_count(), 00337 statistic_num = 0, plot_name = None): 00338 """ 00339 Minimizes a given function using a specified optimizer and plots the results. 00340 00341 This function performs optimization on a target function within the specified 00342 bounds and additional constraints. The results of the optimization, including 00343 inputs and outputs, are saved to a compressed file, and a plot is generated 00344 to visualize the optimization results. 00345 00346 Args: 00347 name (str): The base name for the output files and plots. 00348 optimizer (Optimizer): The optimization algorithm to be used. 00349 fun (Callable[[ArrayLike], float]): The target function to minimize. 00350 bounds (Bounds): The bounds within which the optimization is performed. 00351 weight_bounds: Constraints on weight values for optimization. 00352 ncon (Optional[int]): The number of constraints in optimization. Defaults 00353 to 0. 00354 value_limits (Optional[ArrayLike]): Limits for input values in the 00355 optimization process. Defaults to None. 00356 num_retries (Optional[int]): Number of retries for optimization in case 00357 of failure or randomness. Defaults to 1024. 00358 exp (Optional[float]): Exponent for value weighting during optimization. 00359 Defaults to 2.0. 00360 workers (Optional[int]): Number of parallel workers used during 00361 optimization. Defaults to the number of CPU cores available. 00362 statistic_num: Statistical parameter to control optimization behavior. 00363 plot_name: Custom name for the output plot. 00364 00365 """ 00366 time0 = time.perf_counter() # optimization start time 00367 name += '_' + optimizer.name 00368 logger.info('optimize ' + name) 00369 xs, ys = minimize(fun, bounds, weight_bounds, ncon, 00370 value_exp = exp, 00371 value_limits = value_limits, 00372 num_retries = num_retries, 00373 optimizer = optimizer, 00374 workers = workers, 00375 statistic_num = statistic_num, plot_name = plot_name) 00376 logger.info(name + ' time ' + str(dtime(time0))) 00377 np.savez_compressed(name, xs=xs, ys=ys) 00378 plot(name, ncon, xs, ys) 00379 00380 def plot(name, ncon, xs, ys, eps = 1E-2, all=True, interp=False, plot3d=False): 00381 """ 00382 Plots the feasible solution space and Pareto front for a given set of data points. 00383 00384 This function processes data points and constraints to determine the feasible 00385 region and subsequently calculates the Pareto-optimal front. It can also 00386 generate visualizations of all solutions and the Pareto front if required. 00387 00388 Args: 00389 name (str): The name for the visualization files. 00390 ncon (int): The number of constraint functions. 00391 xs (array-like): A collection of decision variable values. 00392 ys (array-like): A collection of corresponding objective function values. 00393 eps (float): Tolerance value for feasibility conditions. Default is 1E-2. 00394 all (bool): Flag to indicate if plotting all solutions is required. 00395 Default is True. 00396 interp (bool): Flag to determine if interpolation is applied to the 00397 Pareto front plot. Default is False. 00398 plot3d (bool): Flag indicating whether to create a 3D Pareto front plot. 00399 Default is False. 00400 00401 Raises: 00402 Exception: If an error occurs during computation or plotting. 00403 """ 00404 try: 00405 if ncon > 0: # select feasible 00406 ycon = np.array([np.maximum(y[-ncon:], 0) for y in ys]) 00407 con = np.sum(ycon, axis=1) 00408 nobj = len(ys[0]) - ncon 00409 feasible = np.fromiter((i for i in range(len(ys)) if con[i] < eps), dtype=int) 00410 if len(feasible) > 0: 00411 xs, ys = xs[feasible], np.array([y[:nobj] for y in ys[feasible]]) 00412 else: 00413 print("no feasible") 00414 return 00415 if all: 00416 retry.plot(ys, 'all_' + name + '.png', interp=False) 00417 xs, ys = pareto(xs, ys) 00418 for x, y in zip(xs, ys): 00419 print(str(list(y)) + ' ' + str([round(xi,5) for xi in x])) 00420 retry.plot(ys, 'front_' + name + '.png', interp=interp, plot3d=plot3d) 00421 except Exception as ex: 00422 print(str(ex)) 00423 00424 def adv_minimize_plot(name: str, 00425 optimizer: Optimizer, 00426 fun: Callable[[ArrayLike], float], 00427 bounds: Optional[Bounds], 00428 value_limit: Optional[float] = np.inf, 00429 num_retries: Optional[int] = 1024, 00430 statistic_num: Optional[int] = 0): 00431 """ 00432 Minimizes a given function using the provided optimizer, retries for better results, 00433 plots the outcomes, and saves the results. 00434 00435 This function performs a smart optimization by leveraging retry strategies 00436 to achieve better outcomes. It evaluates the function over all inputs after 00437 optimization, generates convergence plots, and computes a Pareto front, saving 00438 the associated data and visuals. 00439 00440 Args: 00441 name (str): The base name for the output files generated during the 00442 optimization process. 00443 optimizer (Optimizer): The optimization algorithm to be used for minimizing 00444 the function. 00445 fun (Callable[[ArrayLike], float]): The objective function to minimize. 00446 It should accept an input array-like variable and return a float score. 00447 bounds (Optional[Bounds]): Bounds for the optimization process. Defines 00448 the variable limits for the optimization. 00449 value_limit (Optional[float]): A threshold to terminate the optimization 00450 early when the function's value is below this limit. Default is infinity. 00451 num_retries (Optional[int]): The number of retries for optimization to improve 00452 results when the process fails or is suboptimal. Default is 1024. 00453 statistic_num (Optional[int]): A statistic counter for internal use during 00454 optimization or retries. Default is 0. 00455 """ 00456 time0 = time.perf_counter() # optimization start time 00457 name += '_smart_' + optimizer.name 00458 logger.info('smart optimize ' + name) 00459 store = advretry.Store(lambda x:fun(x)[0], bounds, capacity=5000, 00460 num_retries=num_retries, statistic_num = statistic_num) 00461 advretry.retry(store, optimizer.minimize, value_limit) 00462 xs = np.array(store.get_xs()) 00463 ys = np.fromiter((fun(x) for x in xs), dtype=float) 00464 retry.plot(ys, '_all_' + name + '.png', interp=False) 00465 np.savez_compressed(name , xs=xs, ys=ys) 00466 xs, front = pareto(xs, ys) 00467 logger.info(name+ ' time ' + str(dtime(time0))) 00468 retry.plot(front, '_front_' + name + '.png') 00469 00470 def _avg_exp(y, y_exp): 00471 """ 00472 Calculates the generalized mean (also known as the power mean) of a list of numbers. 00473 00474 This function computes a weighted generalized mean of a list of numbers `y` using 00475 the specified exponent `y_exp`. The calculation involves summing the power of each 00476 element in the list to the given exponent and then applying the inverse of the same 00477 exponent to the resulting sum. 00478 00479 Args: 00480 y: List or iterable of numbers for which the generalized mean will be calculated. 00481 y_exp: Exponent parameter to control the type of mean (e.g., arithmetic, geometric). 00482 00483 Returns: 00484 Weighted generalized mean computed from the input list based on the provided exponent. 00485 """ 00486 with warnings.catch_warnings(): 00487 warnings.simplefilter("ignore") 00488 weighted = sum([y[i]**y_exp for i in range(len(y))])**(1.0/y_exp) 00489 return weighted 00490 00491 def _pareto_values(ys): 00492 """ 00493 Determines the Pareto-optimal solutions from a given set of objective values. 00494 00495 The function processes a given 2D array of objective values and identifies 00496 the Pareto-optimal points among them. Pareto-optimal solutions are those that 00497 cannot be dominated by any other solutions in all objectives. 00498 00499 Args: 00500 ys (numpy.ndarray): A 2D array where each row represents a solution, and 00501 each column corresponds to an objective. 00502 00503 Returns: 00504 numpy.ndarray: A 2D array containing only the Pareto-optimal solutions 00505 from the input. 00506 """ 00507 ys = ys[ys.sum(1).argsort()[::-1]] 00508 undominated = np.ones(ys.shape[0], dtype=bool) 00509 for i in range(ys.shape[0]): 00510 n = ys.shape[0] 00511 if i >= n: 00512 break 00513 undominated[i+1:n] = (ys[i+1:] >= ys[i]).any(1) 00514 ys = ys[undominated[:n]] 00515 return ys 00516 00517 def _pareto(ys): 00518 """ 00519 Identifies the Pareto-optimal points from the given set of points. 00520 00521 Pareto-optimal points are those for which no other point dominates them. A point 00522 dominates another if it is less than or equal to the other point in all dimensions 00523 and strictly less in at least one dimension. This function removes dominated points 00524 from the dataset iteratively. 00525 00526 Args: 00527 ys (np.ndarray): A 2D array where each row represents a point in a multidimensional 00528 space, and each column corresponds to a dimension. 00529 00530 Returns: 00531 np.ndarray: An array of indices representing the Pareto-optimal points in the 00532 provided dataset. 00533 """ 00534 pareto = np.arange(ys.shape[0]) 00535 index = 0 # Next index to search for 00536 while index < len(ys): 00537 mask = np.any(ys < ys[index], axis=1) 00538 mask[index] = True 00539 pareto = pareto[mask] # Remove dominated points 00540 ys = ys[mask] 00541 index = np.sum(mask[:index])+1 00542 return pareto 00543
